parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: To go down, come down, either from the sky or from higher land, descend. From kata and the base of basis; to descend.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A mountain, hill. Probably from an obsolete oro; a mountain: -hill, mount(-ain).

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To give a commission (instructions), order; To admonish, prohibit.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To relate in full, describe, narrate. From dia and hegeomai; to relate fully.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Plural
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To raise up, set up; I rise from among (the) dead; I arise, appear. From ana and histemi; to stand up.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.
